intro: Malvastrum fremontii var. niveum, commonly known as the white evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, pale yellow to white flowers that open in the evening, hence its common name. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
